Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer has announced that the UK will recognise a Palestinian state in September unless Israel meets certain conditions. The delicate politics behind the UK's move on Palestinian statehood The government's statehood policy marks a hugely significant shift in the UK's diplomatic stance. Bowen: Starmer's announcement a big change for British foreign policy PM Sir Keir Starmer has said the UK will recognise a Palestinian state in September unless Israel takes "substantive steps to end the appalling situation in Gaza". Watch: How did Gaza get to the brink of starvation? The BBC's diplomatic correspondent Paul Adams explains how the people of Gaza have reached a point of starvation. Bowen: Air dropping aid is an act of desperation that won't end hunger in Gaza Air drops can look good on television, but deliver very little aid and endanger civilian lives. Human stories Two girls shot in Gaza - BBC pieces together what happened and looks at dozens more child shootings Layan and Mira were killed in proximity to IDF soldiers - the Israeli military says intentional harm to civilians is prohibited and their cases will be examined by the authorities. Gazan boy first to be treated in UK for war injuries Majd, 15, was almost killed by an Israeli tank shell last February. He has finally arrived in the UK for reconstructive surgery. 'We need a real solution': Gazans welcome aid plan but fear it will not end crisis Israel says aid convoys will be allowed into Gaza, after weeks of mounting pressure and warnings of starvation. 'I'm so tired': Mother of starving Gazan baby speaks to BBC Hedaya al-Muta'wi's 18-month-old son Mohammed suffers from malnutrition due to famine, weighing just 6kg. He went to get aid and didn't come back - stories of people killed in Gaza As aid agencies warn of "mass starvation", the BBC hears from the relatives of some of those killed in the past week.
